entry.title: The Idiot’s Guide to Github Pages with Jekyll for custom domains

link.title: The Idiot's Guide to Github Pages with Jekyll for custom domains

entry.content:
#H1 The Idiot’s Guide to Github Pages with Jekyll for custom domains

  1. jekyll new <blogname>pacda inside that folder, create a folder “docs”
  2. initiate it as a repository
  3. in _config.yml add: exclude: - [CNAME] keep_files: [CNAME]
  4. jekyll build –destination ./docs –watch
  5. add Gemfile and Gemfile.lock to gitignore. Add all. commit. push.
  6. in Github settings, point github pages to docs

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: #H1 The Idiot’s Guide to Github Pages with Jekyll for custom domains jekyll new <blogname>pacda inside that folder, create a folder “docs” initiate it as a repository in _config.yml add: exclude: - [CNAME] keep_files: [CNAME] jekyll build –destination ./docs –watch add Gemfile and Gemfile.lock to gitignore. Add all. commit. push. in Github settings, point github pages to docs
